### Calculate model performance metrics
### Select models with lowest AICc and highest mean testing AUC. In this case, a single model has both features
```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
results <- list()
results_kable <- list()
best_aic_list <- list()
best_auc_list <- list()
best_model_list <- list()
best_aic_list2 <- list()
count = 1
for (i in model_list){
  result <- eval.results(i)
  result2 <- eval.results(i)
  result <- result[,c(1,2,4,8,16,17,19)]
  colnames(result) <- c("Features","Regularization.multiplier","Training.AUC","Mean.testing.AUC","AICc","Delta AICc","Parameters") 
  result_kable <- knitr::kable(result, "simple", digits = 2)
  results[[count]] = as.data.frame(result)
  results_kable[[count]] = result_kable
  
  best_aic <- result[which.min(result$AICc),]
  best_aic2 <- result2[which.min(result2$AICc),]
  best_auc <- result[which.max(result$Mean.testing.AUC),]

  model <- eval.models(i)[[best_aic2$tune.args]]
  best_model_list[[count]] <- model
  
  best_aic_list[[count]] = as.data.frame(best_aic)
  best_auc_list[[count]] = as.data.frame(best_auc)
  best_aic_list2[[count]] = as.data.frame(best_aic2)
  
  count=count+1  
}
```

### Make contour corresponding to Lemna minor distribution
lm <- read.csv("lm.csv")
colnames(lm)[which(names(lm) == "decimalLongitude")] <- "lon"
colnames(lm)[which(names(lm) == "decimalLatitude")] <- "lat"

#removing data without geographic coordinates
lm_clean <- subset(lm, !is.na(lon) & !is.na(lat))
lm_clean <- lm_clean[, c("lon", "lat")]

#these northern coordinate boundaries in NA correspond to sampled occurrence data in Armitage (2023), which excludes extreme occurrences in northern regions (a more conservative distribution)
lm_clean_na <- lm_clean [((lm_clean$lon >= -135 & lm_clean$lon <= -50) & (lm_clean$lat >= 16 & lm_clean$lat <= 65)), ]
coordinates(lm_clean_na) <- ~lon+lat
crs(lm_clean_na) <- crs(lm_clean_na)

lm_clean_europe <- lm_clean [((lm_clean$lon >= -12 & lm_clean$lon <= 31.55) & (lm_clean$lat >= 34.5 & lm_clean$lat <= 71.01)), ]
coordinates(lm_clean_europe) <- ~lon+lat
crs(lm_clean_europe) <- crs(lm_clean_europe)

envs_lake <- raster::brick('bioclim_lakes_10km.tif')
envs = envs_lake[[c(1)]]

model.extent<-extent(min(lm_clean_na$lon),max(lm_clean_na$lon),
                     min(lm_clean_na$lat),max(lm_clean_na$lat))
modelEnv <- raster::crop(envs,model.extent)

e <- extent(modelEnv)
# coerce to a SpatialPolygons object
p <- as(e, 'SpatialPolygons')  

# make all values the same. Either do
r <- modelEnv > -Inf
# or alternatively
# r <- reclassify(x, cbind(-Inf, Inf, 1))

# convert to polygons (you need to have package 'rgeos' installed for this to work)
pp_na <- rasterToPolygons(r, dissolve=TRUE)

model.extent<-extent(min(lm_clean_europe$lon),max(lm_clean_europe$lon),
                     min(lm_clean_europe$lat),max(lm_clean_europe$lat))
modelEnv <- raster::crop(envs,model.extent)

e <- extent(modelEnv)
# coerce to a SpatialPolygons object
p <- as(e, 'SpatialPolygons')  

# make all values the same. Either do
r <- modelEnv > -Inf
# or alternatively
# r <- reclassify(x, cbind(-Inf, Inf, 1))

# convert to polygons (you need to have package 'rgeos' installed for this to work)
pp_europe <- rasterToPolygons(r, dissolve=TRUE)

# Compare TPC with response curves for BIO1
```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, include=FALSE}
library(rTPC)
library(nls.multstart)

### L. minor
datin1 <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Cuddington-Lab/thermal-experiments/main/dataset_autocorrelation_2022-2023.csv",
                   header=TRUE, stringsAsFactors = TRUE,fileEncoding="UTF-8-BOM")
datin2 <- read.csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Cuddington-Lab/thermal-experiments/main/dataset_autocorrelation_2021-2022.csv",
                   header=TRUE, stringsAsFactors = TRUE,fileEncoding="UTF-8-BOM")
datin <- rbind(datin1,datin2)

datin$Frond_count <- datin$Frond_count_1 + datin$Frond_count_2 + datin$Frond_count_3

datin <- subset(datin, Treatment == "constant")

# remove failed experiments
datin <- subset(datin, (!Errors == "y")|is.na(Errors))

# remove experiments in which nutrients were not replaced 
# (a lack of nutrients is probably causing small reproductive output)
datin <- subset(datin, !(Species == "LP" & Mean_temperature == 24))
datin <- subset(datin, !(Species == "Field_LM" & Mean_temperature == 24))
datin <- subset(datin, !(Species == "LP" & Mean_temperature == 26 & Frond_count == 16))


tpc_model <- subset(datin,!Species=="Lab_LM")

tpc_model <- within(tpc_model, Species <- relevel(Species, ref = "Field_LM"))

tpc_model$Frond_count[tpc_model$Frond_count == 0] <- 0.001
tpc_model$r <- (log(tpc_model$Frond_count)- log(12)) / 5

#removing outliers (as selected model was not passing shapiro test for normality when including all observations)
outliers <- boxplot(tpc_model$r, plot=FALSE)$out
tpc_model2<- tpc_model[-which(tpc_model$r %in% outliers),]

tpc <- data.frame(temp=tpc_model2$Mean_temperature,frond=tpc_model2$r, Species=tpc_model2$Species)

tpc$temp <- as.numeric(as.character(tpc$temp))

mylist <- list()
mylist[[1]] <- subset(tpc,Species=="Field_LM")
mylist[[2]] <- subset(tpc,Species=="LP")


# choose model
mod = "ratkowsky_1983"

new_data <- data.frame(temp = seq(min(datin$Mean_temperature), max(datin$Mean_temperature), 0.5))
all_results <- list()
count = 1
for (i in mylist){
  # get start vals
  start_vals <- get_start_vals(i[, 1], i[, 2], model_name = mod)
  # get limits
  low_lims <- get_lower_lims(i[, 1], i[, 2], model_name = mod)
  upper_lims <- get_upper_lims(i[, 1], i[, 2], model_name = mod)
  # fit model
  fit <- nls_multstart(frond~ratkowsky_1983(temp = temp, tmin, tmax, a, b),
                       data = i[, 1:2],
                       iter = 500,
                       start_lower = start_vals - 10,
                       start_upper = start_vals + 10,
                       lower = low_lims,
                       upper = upper_lims,
                       supp_errors = 'Y')
  
  result <- predict(fit, newdata = new_data)
  
  all_results[[count]] = as.data.frame(result)
  
  count=count+1
}  

df <- as.data.frame(do.call(cbind, all_results))
colnames(df)  <- c("tpc_fieldLM","tpc_LP")
df$temp <- new_data$temp
```

### Lake: 10th percentile training presence threshold
```{r echo=TRUE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
e.mx.l.lake <- model_list[[1]]

# Extract the predicted values for all presence points
pred.vals <- raster::extract(pred.seq.lake, e.mx.l.lake@occs[,1:2])

# Impose the minimum presence point threshold
or.min.threshold <- pred.seq.lake > min(pred.vals)

# To impose the 10% presence threshold, first find how many records represent 10% of the records
# ceiling: to round number
n10 <- ceiling(length(pred.vals) * 0.1)

lake_10_threshold <- sort(pred.vals)[n10]
lake_10_threshold

# Then impose the 10% threshold
# sort(pred.vals)[n10]: sorting predictions from lowest to highest; selecting prediction value matching the
# 50th smallest value (10% of training data points); then only keeping predictions above this value
or.10.threshold <- pred.seq.lake > sort(pred.vals)[n10]

# Plot to visualize
par(mfrow=c(2,2))
plot(pred.seq.lake, main='Continuous')
points(e.mx.l.lake@occs[,c(1,2)], pch=16)

plot(or.min.threshold, main='Min omission threshold')
points(e.mx.l.lake@occs[,c(1,2)], pch=16)

plot(or.10.threshold, main='10% omission threshold')
points(e.mx.l.lake@occs[,c(1,2)], pch=16)
```

e.mx.l.air.future <- model_list[[3]]

# Extract the predicted values for all presence points
pred.vals <- raster::extract(pred.seq.future, e.mx.l.air.future@occs[,c(1,2)])

# Impose the minimum presence point threshold
or.min.threshold <- pred.seq.future > min(pred.vals)

# To impose the 10% presence threshold, first find how many records represent 10% of the records
# ceiling: to round number
n10 <- ceiling(length(pred.vals) * 0.1)

future_10_threshold <- sort(pred.vals)[n10]
future_10_threshold

# Then impose the 10% threshold
# sort(pred.vals)[n10]: sorting predictions from lowest to highest; selecting prediction value matching the
# 50th smallest value (10% of training data points); then only keeping predictions above this value
or.10.threshold <- pred.seq.future > sort(pred.vals)[n10]

# Plot to visualize
par(mfrow=c(2,2))
plot(pred.seq.lake, main='Continuous')
points(e.mx.l.air.future@occs[,c(1,2)], pch=16)

plot(or.min.threshold, main='Min omission threshold')
points(e.mx.l.air.future@occs[,c(1,2)], pch=16)

plot(or.10.threshold, main='10% omission threshold')
points(e.mx.l.air.future@occs[,c(1,2)], pch=16)
